channel.title: How to take off automatic char creation on easy rsc
channel.description: How can I take off automatic char creation on Easy RSC and put it on a website with captch? Or would I need MySQL.

item.title: How to take off automatic char creation on easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

Thanks you all. Fixed

item.title: How to take off automatic char creation on easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:4, topic:416890”]PlayerLoader class

Find

File fi = new File("players/" + user + ".cfg"); copy(new File("players/Template"), fi); GUI.writeValue(user, "pass", pass); Logger.print("Account Created: " + user, 3); return 1; }

Replace with

return 0; }

This will stop people registering via the client.[/quote]That will still make the files… Anyone could fill the harddrive up or keep it busy by creating shitloads of new users.

Read full topic

item.title: How to take off automatic char creation on easy rsc
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“A Gh0st, post:5, topic:416890”][quote author=waj link=topic=518825.msg3770611#msg3770611 date=1317643264]
PlayerLoader class

Find

File fi = new File("players/" + user + ".cfg"); copy(new File("players/Template"), fi); GUI.writeValue(user, "pass", pass); Logger.print("Account Created: " + user, 3); return 1; }

Replace with

return 0; }

This will stop people registering via the client.
[/quote]

That’s perfect. Thanks Waj. Now we just gotta find a way to make them register on the forums. Shouldn’t be too difficult…[/quote]

PHP page for player registration, I believe it is written by Zorian while he was still in his learning stages, It could be done A LOT better.

[code=php]<?php
$main_dir = “C://Users//Administrator//Desktop//Client//Server//”;
if(isset($_POST[‘submit’])){
$error = 0;
$username = $POST[‘username’];
$password = $POST[‘password’];
$password2 = $POST[‘password2’];
$username = str_replace(" ", "", $username);
$password = str_replace(" ", "", $password);
$password2 = str_replace(" ", "", $password2);
//$user_id = “PUT UZER ID VB THING HERE PlOCKS”;

if(file_exists($main_dir . "players//" . $username . ".cfg")){
    die("username name already in use!");
    $error + 1;
}
if ($password != $password2){
    die ("Error: Passwords do not match");
    $erorr + 1;
}
if (strlen($password) < 3 or strlen($password) > 20){
    die ("Error: Password must be between 3 - 20 username");
    $error + 1;
}
if (strlen($username) < 3 or strlen($username) > 12){
    die ("Error: Username must be between 3 - 12 username");
    $error + 1;
}
if($error == 0){
    $template = $main_dir . "players//Template";
    $account = $main_dir . "players//" . $username . ".cfg";
    if(!copy($template, $account)) {
        die("Error");
    }
    $account_array = parse_ini_file($account, true);
    $account_array['pass'] = $password;
    //$account_array['owner'] = $user_id;
    if (write_ini($account_array, $account)){
        die("Account Created!");
    }else{
        die("Error, fail.");
    }
}

}else{
echo ’

Username:


Password:





';
}
function write_ini($assoc_arr, $path) {
foreach ($assoc_arr as $key=>$elem) {
if (is_array($elem)) {
for ($i = 0; $i < count($elem); $i++)
$content .= $key . “=” . $elem[$i] . “\n”;
}
else if ($elem == NULL)
$content .= $key . “=\n”;
else
$content .= $key . “=” . $elem . “\n”;
}

            if (!$handle = fopen($path, 'w'))
                    return false;
            
            if (!fwrite($handle, $content))
                    return false;
            
            fclose($handle);
            
            return true;
    }

?>[/code]

change this line to make it work for you
